sub_topic: Determining the surface area of a cone.
message_1: A right circular cone has a radius of 5 cm and a slant height of 13 cm. Find the surface area (excluding the base) of the cone in cm².
message_2:
To find the surface area (excluding the base) of a right circular cone, we use the formula:

Surface area = π * radius * slant height

In this case, the radius is 5 cm and the slant height is 13 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Surface area = π * 5 * 13

Surface area = 65π cm²

The surface area of the cone (excluding the base) is 65π cm².
